title: Will OCE players who had more than 100 wins on dominion before transferring still get the icon?

embed.description: We launched Dominion more than four years ago as an alternative game mode designed to challenge players with fast-paced skirmishes, capture-and-hold gameplay, and different skills to master. Back then, we truly believed the mode would introduce new players to League of Legends and provide current players with an experience as captivating as Summoner's Rift.

body: I loved dominion and i'm pretty sad it never made its way to OCE after i transferred. However i did have 202 wins before transferring so i'll be honest, i'd be pretty cut if i don't get the icon. Just wondering if OCE is forgotten in this respect.

replies.body:
Hey man,

TL;DR Yes

"For players who have over 100 wins in matchmade Dominion games (not including Co-op vs. AI) from other servers that have transferred to OCE, you will be receiving a Summoner Icon. You can expect the icon to land in your account within two weeks of this announcement."

http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/retiring-dominion

*Logs in to see how many dom wins I have.

got, 1093 take downs and 558 points, but at the time I couldn't play league and I wasn't good at it :(

Thank you for the reply. That is great news, and at least some consolation for lovers of dominion like me :)

Hello.

I have a question regarding Riot's recent decision to retire the dominion queue.
Starting in S2, I really enjoyed dominion, and I was very disappointed that OCE never had it when we finally got our own server.

In your recent post you have different content regarding the announcement based on region.
Specifically, comparing the NA and OCE posts.
[OCE Announcement](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/retiring-dominion)
[NA Announcement](http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/features/retiring-dominion)

You have omitted the information that you would be taking a snapshot of everyone's current win count for dominion and only be handing out the icon to those who had more than 100 before the post went live.

I love dominion to the point that even though I only have 73wins(From before I transferred to OCE), I am willing to transfer to NA to get 27 more wins to get the icon, and then transfer back.

However, before I transfer, I'd like to know whether I can would still be eligible to get the icon as it sucks being so close to 100 not being able to play on our own server.

I hope for speedy response as I'd like to spend as much time on favorite(albeit soon to be gone) game mode.

Hey ViviBlueMage,

TL;DR The snap shot is of wins from before the announce, so transferring now and playing a bunch of dominion won't get you the icon. Playing dominion games on NA now doesnt count towards the icon in general.

From the NA post
"For players who’ve made the Crystal Scar their home over the last four years, we’ll be taking a snapshot of the queue today just before this post goes live. Then we’ll give out an exclusive, never-to-be-reproduced Summoner Icon to anyone with over 100 wins in matchmade Dominion games (not including Co-op vs AI). "

The icon is intended to represent the commitment those players with 100, 500, or even a 1000+ wins invested into the map. They spent their precious time playing it. That's why even in NA it's a snap shot of wins **before** the post went live.

Thank you for responding Maraudaur.

I can understand the reasoning for this for servers that do have a dominion queue, but it is extremely unfair for OCE players.

There's a major difference between distributing a reward for players that **had the chance** and did put in the time, compared to those who **didn't have a chance** at all.

With the OCE server originally arriving 27th/June/2013, Almost **3 years ago**, Not once did you ever open the dominion queue.
Scratch that, That statement is incorrect as Riot OCE did actually open dominion queue briefly(for less than 40minutes) back around 2014-Jan/Feb when the servers were getting DDOSed, Riot OCE decided to turn the servers off, and when they turned it back on, They must've "accidentally" left dominion queue on.(This sucked cause it got me and my friends hopes up).

Something needs to be done for OCE, that both follows Riot's wish to reward only dedicated past players as well as allowing those past players to have a proper chance.

What seems a little unfair is that people who transferred to OCE close to it's inception had no way of knowing that Dominion would _never_ be available. I'm at 82 dominion wins and I'd like to imagine that if I had just been given the chance to play Dominion that I may have reached that magic 100, or maybe more than that. I'm sure I share this feeling with other OCE veterans and I guess we'd like the rules bent a little if it was possible. (At the end of the day it's just an icon but it's an icon we could have been eligible for.)

What pisses me off and leaves me scratching my head is why is riot removing dominion from custom games?
Retiring Dominion Queue is one thing, but it makes no sense why Crystal Scar is being removed from custom games, since it is not strictly for Dominion.

Hey guys,

I know this announcement sucks =(

But I just wanted to provide some extra clarity on why it is being removed from customs as well.

> Unfortunately, keeping Dominion available in Custom games still has the same cost as being a matchmade queue. :/ We have to ensure all champions work with capture points, items, etc.
> The art on the map is also far behind what we'd consider the 'quality bar' for League nowadays. It would be a herculean SRU level effort to bring it up to parity (when we could better spend that time/resources doing something awesome on SR instead).
-L4T3NCY
